result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:58 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Shanea Cheree Wichelmann in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Shanea Cheree Wichelmann.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF709 (STC) , 2021CF000794(ARGN), 21CF859 (ARGN), 22CF397(ARGN).  As to the 3 files that ARGN are needed- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all 3 cases.  Waives speedy trial. Court sets these matters out to allow time for PD's office to find a new attorney.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:01 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:00 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Shanea Cheree Wichelmann in court.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Shanea Cheree Wichelmann.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF709- STC, 21CF794, 21CF859, & 22CF397- remaining files set for PH.  ADA Becker proceeds to PH on 21CF794- S/T of Deputy Aaron Boldt.  Direct by ADA Becker. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Becker. Recross by Atty Harrelson.  ADA Becker asks that the Court take Judicial Notice of bond in 21CF709.  Court takes Judicial Notice of signed bond in 21CF709 and Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. As to 21CF859- S/T of Shelby Hilden from JSC.  Direct by ADA Becker. Cross by Atty Harrelson.  ADA Becker  ADA Becker asks that the Court take Judicial Notice of bond in 21CF794.  Court takes Judicial Notice of signed bond in 21CF794. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court calls 22CF397- S/T of Detective Joseph Kastens Drug Detective for NRPD.  Direct by ADA Becker. Cross by Atty Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Becker.  ADA Becker asks that the Court take Judicial Notice of bond in 21CF709 & 21CF794.  Court takes Judicial Notice of signed bond in 21CF709 & 21CF794. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:33 PM. bph

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.
